pullRequest.body:
This adds AffineMap.pi, and some related extensionality lemmas.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: @eric-wieser Anything else you need from me here?
@eric-wieser Just bumping this, is this ok to merge?

Sorry for dropping the ball @Timeroot; on reflection I think that we don't want the primed `pi'`, since we don't have any analogs of it in other categories. I'll push a commit to remove it, since I have the branch open.

bors d+

Please merge once CI is happy.

Sorry again for forgetting about this, don't hesitate to ping on Zulip next time.

:v: Timeroot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
No worries, thanks for taking a look! :)
bors r+
Already running a review
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9260066507/job/25473142780)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9260066507/job/25473142669)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9260066507/job/25473143006)
This generally looks good, thanks; just some small things to clean up.
I think it would be best to use the full spelling here, with `.linear` instead of `.2`.
This docstring is a bit weird because it says it is a version of itself! Can you instead make the comparison to `LinearMap.pi`?
Oops, I meant to write "dependently typed version of `AffineMap.pi'`." The `pi'`, with the tick, is the more readable one with no types depending on `i`.

Again, using `.1` is fragile. You can make this more concise as
```suggestion
  toFun m a := f a m
```

```suggestion
  map_vadd' _ _ := funext fun _ ↦ map_vadd _ _ _
```
probably works
I don't think this is worth having; we should already have that every linear map is also an affine map
dropped
I doubt we actually want this, but if we did it would be as an `abbrev` which would remove the need for any of the lemmas below.
Changed to `abbrev`

```suggestion
/-- Two affine maps from a Pi-tyoe of modules `(i : ι) → φv i` are equal if they are equal in their
```
so that this shows up in the docs
Do we have a linear map version of this? If so, can you mention it in the docstring?

nit:
```suggestion
  ⟨fun h ↦ ⟨congrArg _ h, by inhabit P1; exact default, by rw [h]⟩,
   fun h ↦ Exists.casesOn h.2 fun _ hp ↦ ext_linear h.1 hp⟩
```
is probably how we'd usually format this.
Can you hoist `V3` and `P3` to the variables line?
